block.p: QUARTERLY REPORTS -- Earnings season gets under way with the first Dow component, Alcoa, reporting first-quarter results (Tuesday), followed by the BlackBerry maker Research in Motion (Wednesday), Rite Aid (Thursday) and another Dow component, General Electric (Friday).

SIGNALS ON THE ECONOMY -- The main economic news will come on Friday, with the producer price index for April and the trade deficit for March. Retailers will report their same-store sales for March (Thursday). The Federal Open Market Committee will issue minutes of its March 21 meeting (Wednesday).
PAINKILLER REVIEW -- An advisory panel for the Food and Drug Administration is scheduled to meet to discuss Merck's application to market the painkiller Arcoxia in the United States (Thursday).

NACCHIO TRIAL -- The defense in the trial of Joseph P. Nacchio, the former chief executive of Qwest Communications, is expected to wrap up Monday or Tuesday, and Mr. Nacchio may take the stand in his own defense.

PAINKILLER REVIEW -- An advisory panel for the Food and Drug Administration is scheduled to meet to discuss Merck's application to market the painkiller Arcoxia in the United States (Thursday).
